page.title: 03Ashlett Creek
page.content: Ashlett Creek is a small waterside area on the edge of Southampton waters,a tide mill was built by French soldiers during the time of Napoleon. Behind the mill a small millpond still remains,this stored the seawater when the tide came in so that the mill could work when the tide came in and out. The mill was used to grind corn. It is now a social club owned by ESSO Refinery. Here is an advertisment from the Salisbury Journal of 1752..... {Tide mill one pair of French stones {and one pair of pikes,two bolting {mills,two wheels with all the tackling {there unto belonging,a dwelling {house,stable and two outhouses situate {at Ashlett in Fawley Parish,6 miles {from Soton,14 from Portsmouth very {handy for business.Rent about Â£16 per {annum carried on to Â£2000 a year trade
